newsitem.title: DENMARK: SAS to stay in top 20 Danish shares-survey.
newsitem.headline: SAS to stay in top 20 Danish shares-survey.

text.p: A new Danish survey indicates that Scandinavian Airlines System (SAS) will keep its place among the twenty most-traded Danish shares when the Copenhagen bourse's new KFX index is published on November 1.

Contrary to an October 7 report by the Copenhagen Stock Exchange, the new projection sees SAS hanging on in 20th place, but agrees with the bourse that shipping and trading group East Asiatic Company and insurance group Topdanmark will drop out.
A staffer at the bank which prepared the new report requested anonymity for himself and his employer.

He said that like the stock exchange the bank assessment expected BG Bank, the country's fourth-largest bank, to enter the 1996/97 index. The two reports also agreed that biotech group Christian Hansen Holding would make the top 20.
But the bourse differed in seeing SAS replaced by the A-share of holding company Sophus Berendsen SPBCa.CO, which is already on the list with its B-Share.
